intro: Straussiella iranica, commonly known as the Iranian straussiella, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered white or yellow flowers. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
